text: hello this is chef Jon welcome to our
500th video episode you know I've been
agonizing for weeks about what to do
exactly for this momentous occasion and
I couldn't come up with anything okay
so I'm not even going to do a recipe I'm
going to do this a potato ball carved
for my potato box carved from an actual
potato so not only is this video
significant historically because it's
the 500th food wishes video it's also
historic because this has never ever
been filmed before on YouTube so here's
what we do we're going to cut a square
out of a potato then I'm going to go
around with a knife and make four cuts
on each side to make sort of a box see
that about an eighth of an inch in from
the edges on all six sides then I'm
going to switch to this knife which is
called a turning knife or a bird's beak
now this is not very common in your you
know home cook knife sets you can find
this at any kitchen supply store online
of course so basically with the tip of
the knife at a very slight angle you're
going to go around cutting out the
corners on all six sides I like to have
a bowl of cold water to rinse the thing
off as I trim and by cutting out the
corners with a knife angled down
slightly you're going to basically start
the shape of a ball all right once
you've done that on all six sides you
can take the tip of the knife and go
along the surface of your what's now
almost a ball until it releases from the
potato box and as soon as you can kind
of move it and spin it then it's just a
matter of trimming it down to a perfect
ball and see that the moment when it
releases and it starts to spin so
liberating and I know what you guys are
thinking chef Jon you're not just
showing this to show some trick and to
show off your world-class knife skills
you're showing this to us because it's
kind of a metaphor for your videos
helping us discover our inner chef our
inner cook showing us that we can take
something and create something amazing
from it that we didn't even know existed
with it well you know what that's a hell
of a theory but totally wrong I just
wanted to show you this because it's so
cool I mean it's a potato ball in a
potato box carved from a potato
and the first time successfully filmed
and uploaded to YouTube anyway that's
our 500 video I hope you enjoyed that I
could not have even come close to doing
500 videos without an amazing amount of
support from all you fans I have so many
people to thank thank you thank you
thank you thank you to YouTube and
Google for supporting me
thank you hungry nation next new
networks thank you to my family to my
wife Michelle incredible support I
wouldn't be able to do it if it wasn't
for them but most of all most of all
thank you I hope you continue to enjoy
these videos I hope you have a fantastic
Thanksgiving I hope you cook lots of
stuff from the site and as always enjoy
you
